subject: Re: Q : JUNIT : Java.lang.IllegalAccessError
msgSnippet: What version JDK are you using?  Are you using Ant or are you compiling from the command line? Here are some possible pointers:
messageBody:
What version JDK are you using? Are you using Ant or are you
compiling from the command line?

Here are some possible pointers:

http://forum.java.sun.com/thread.jsp?forum=27&thread=282277

http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/8797/2002/6/0/8951109/

Let us know what you find ... i'm intrigued.

Mike


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Vishal Goyal" <vishal_goyal@i...>
wrote:
> I think that is not the case. As, when I remove any of the methods
and
> make the count to 5(five methods )in all it works very fine .
>
> Rgds,
> Vishal.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@f...]
> Sent: Thursday, December 19, 2002 10:49 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Q : JUNIT : Java.lang.IllegalAccessError
>
>
> <From the JavaDocs>
> Thrown if an application attempts to access or modify a field, or to
> call a method that it does not have access to.
>
> Normally, this error is caught by the compiler; this error can only
> occur at run time if the definition of a class has incompatibly
changed.
> <From the JavaDocs>
>
>
> =jason
> [:question | ^One]
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@d...]
> Sent: Thursday, December 19, 2002 12:19 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Q : JUNIT : Java.lang.IllegalAccessError
>
>
> So said Vishal Goyal on 2002-12-19 --------------------
>
> >Hi ,
> >I am writing six test methods in a Test class.
> >
> >While compiling it is giving me this error
> Java.lang.IllegalAccessError
> >: class <sun.reflect.GeneratedConstructorAccessor5 cannot access
its
> >superclass sun.reflect.ConstructorAccessorImpl>.
> >
> >Please provide some pointer.
>
> It is impossible to provide a pointer without seeing the code.
Thanks.
